logging_system.apps module

class logging_system.apps.LoggingSystemConfig(app_name, app_module)[source]

name = 'logging_system'

logging_system.consumers module

WebSocket consumer to broadcast Local Sidereal Time (LST) and UTC time in real-time.

Uses Django Channels’ AsyncWebsocketConsumer to: - Send LST and UTC time every second - Handle graceful disconnection

Imports: - compute_lst from lst.py for real-time sidereal calculations

class logging_system.consumers.LSTConsumer(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: AsyncWebsocketConsumer

WebSocket consumer that continuously sends current Local Sidereal Time (LST) and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) to connected clients every second.

This is useful for astronomical interfaces needing real-time sky tracking.

async connect()[source]

Called when a WebSocket connection is initiated. Accepts the connection and starts sending LST + UTC time every second.

async disconnect(close_code)[source]

Called when the WebSocket connection is closed. Attempts to remove the client from any groups (if used in the future).

Parameters:

close_code (int) – Close code for the connection.

logging_system.forms module

Forms for the Telescope Logging System.

Each form maps to a corresponding model or functional utility: - GeneralInfoForm: Main session metadata (hidden + visible fields) - EnvironmentalConditionForm: Atmospheric data inputs - ObservationForm: Target object info, split RA/Dec - TelescopeConfigurationForm: Setup for tracking, guiding, focus - InstrumentationForm: Instrument and exposure setup - RemoteOperationForm: Remote control session toggles - CommentForm: Freeform remarks - EmailForm: For sending PDFs via email - FitsUploadForm: For FITS file metadata injection

All forms are compatible with crispy-forms and integrate Bootstrap classes.

logging_system.lst module

Local Sidereal Time (LST) Calculator.

This module provides functions to: - Convert a datetime to Julian Date. - Calculate the number of days in a given month. - Convert IST to Local Sidereal Time for a given longitude (default: Mt. Abu).

Sidereal Time is used in astronomy to track celestial objects. It differs from solar time.

logging_system.lst.compute_lst(ist_dt, longitude=72.7761)[source]

Compute Local Sidereal Time (LST) from IST.

Steps: 1. Convert IST to UTC. 2. Calculate Julian Date. 3. Compute number of days since J2000.0. 4. Calculate GMST using astronomical formula. 5. Adjust GMST with local longitude to get LST. 6. Handle edge cases (LST overflows, day wrap-around).

Parameters:

  • ist_dt (datetime) – Datetime in IST.

  • longitude (float) – Longitude in degrees (default: Mt. Abu - 72.7761° E).

Returns:

Corresponding LST datetime object.

Return type:

datetime

logging_system.lst.days_in_month(year, month)[source]

Return the number of days in a given month and year. Handles leap years.

Parameters:

  • year (int) – Year

  • month (int) – Month (1-12)

Returns:

Number of days

Return type:

int

logging_system.lst.julian_date(dt)[source]

Convert a datetime object (IST) to Julian Date.

Parameters:

dt (datetime) – Datetime in IST.

Returns:

Julian Date value adjusted to UTC.

Return type:

float

logging_system.models module

Models for the Telescope Logging System.

Each model corresponds to a form section in the logging system and maps to a specific category of telescope observation data: - GeneralInfo: Main session data - EnvironmentalCondition: Weather and atmosphere - Observation: Target celestial object info - TelescopeConfiguration: Equipment settings during session - Instrumentation: Instrument use and exposure data - RemoteOperation: Remote access configuration - Comments: Optional user remarks

Each model links to GeneralInfo through a OneToOneField for structured session tracking.

class logging_system.models.Comments(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Stores additional comments or notes related to the observation session.

general_info

One-to-one relationship with GeneralInfo.

Type:

GeneralInfo

comments

Freeform comment text.

Type:

str

exception DoesNotExist

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

comments

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

general_info

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a one-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Restaurant(Model):
    place = OneToOneField(Place, related_name='restaurant')

Restaurant.place is a ForwardOneToOneDescriptor instance.

general_info_id
id

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

objects = <django.db.models.manager.Manager object>

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

logging_system.report_utils module

logging_system.report_utils.generate_pdf_reportlab(session_data, filepath)[source]

Generates a PDF report of a telescope log session using ReportLab.

This function formats observational data, environmental conditions, telescope settings, and comments into a visually structured PDF using tables and styled paragraphs.

Parameters:

  • session_data (dict) – A dictionary containing all observational session data structured by category (general, weather, observation, etc.).

  • filepath (str) – Full file path where the generated PDF will be saved.

Returns:

Writes output directly to the given filepath.

Return type:

None

logging_system.routing module

logging_system.tests module

logging_system.urls module

logging_system.views module

Views for the Telescope Logging System.

Handles: - Multi-section form submission (general info, weather, telescope, observation, etc.) - PDF generation and download - Email sending with PDF attachment via SMTP or app email - FITS file upload and metadata injection - Log listing, filtering, and detail views - Weather data retrieval from API

logging_system.views.create_pdf_file(session_id)[source]

Generate a PDF log file for a given session ID.

Parameters:

session_id (int) – The unique session identifier.

Returns:

Path to the generated PDF file.

Return type:

str

logging_system.views.fetch_weather_data(request)[source]

Fetch current weather data from the WeatherAPI and return as JSON.

Returns:

Dictionary containing temperature, humidity, wind speed, and cloud cover.

Return type:

JsonResponse

logging_system.views.fits_view(request)[source]

Allow users to upload a FITS file and inject log metadata into its header.

  • Lists existing logs for selection

  • Updates the FITS header fields

  • Returns a modified FITS file as a downloadable response

Returns:

Downloaded FITS file or re-rendered form with messages.

Return type:

HttpResponse

logging_system.views.generate_pdf(request, session_id)[source]

Serve a generated PDF file as a downloadable response.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

  • session_id (int) – The unique session ID.

Returns:

A response with the PDF file attached.

Return type:

FileResponse

logging_system.views.log_data_view(request)[source]

Render the logs list page with filtering support.

Filters supported: - session_id - operator_name - instrument_name - target_name - date

Returns:

Rendered log_data.html with filtered logs.

Return type:

HttpResponse

logging_system.views.send_email(request, session_id)[source]

Send an email with a PDF log attachment to predefined and user-provided recipients.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request containing sender credentials and extra emails.

  • session_id (int) – Session ID used to fetch data and generate the PDF.

Returns:

Redirect to the session detail page with success or error messages.

Return type:

HttpResponseRedirect

Render the detailed view for a specific observation session.

  • request (HttpRequest) – Incoming request object.

  • session_id (int) – Unique ID for the session.

Render the success page after form submission.

Returns:

Rendered success.html template.

Return type:

HttpResponse

logging_system.views.telescope_log_view(request)[source]

Main view for submitting telescope observation logs.

Handles multiple forms for different sections: - General session info - Environmental conditions - Telescope configuration - Observational parameters - Instrumentation - Remote operation - Comments - Email recipient entry

Supports PDF generation and email dispatch.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

Rendered form or redirect with success/failure messages.

Return type:

HttpResponse
